programmes.show_description: Up-and-coming producer and junglist SIMMS steps up to the Sweatbox with half an hour of original productions.
20 years on from Mary Anne Hobbs' Dubstep Warz, Rave Forever pays homage to the sound at its peak.
Joy Anonymous select the best tracks to unwind to as well as creating their very own unique ambient mini mix in this Morning After Mix!
A crafted mix of carefully sequenced calm music to straighten you out.
Let AFRODEUTSCHE provide the perfect, low-lit soundtrack for that first cup of coffee, turning your morning into a masterclass in calm.
Mark and Stuart present a feast of great music and chat for weekend breakfast.
Cerys welcomes Steven Price to explore scoring Ocean with Attenborough, and Neil Brand shares insights from the Laurel & Hardy centenary, celebrating their timeless comic legacy.
Guy chats to musician and songwriter Alexander Carson about Lord Byron, piano collecting and tricorn hats.
Iggy serves up a sonic cocktail to soundtrack your Sunday afternoon. This week, he's got key cuts by Smerz, Miles Davis, Zo√© Basha, Richard Hawley and Angel Bat Dawid.
Mary Anne looks ahead to Tracey Emin's landmark exhibition A Second Life,  which opens at the Tate with words from Tate Director Maria Balshaw and Tracey Emin.
Stuart's featured album is Robert Wyatt's 1975 solo album Ruth is Stranger than Richard. Plus Jethro Tull, Sun Ra and Motorpyscho.
Your weekly trip through mystical musical realms guided by Zakia, sharing jazzy selections filled with saxophones and flutes, as well as words from a maestro of both - Shabaka.
Guy chats to musician and songwriter Alexander Carson about Lord Byron, piano collecting and tricorn hats.
Soundtrack the early hours with back to back music, plus exclusive BBC sessions.
Emily Pilbeam presents a mixtape of her personal selection of tracks from BBC Introducing, including tracks from Featured Artist PEM and a Track Of The Week from MWSOG.
Chris chats with Lucy Rose about her first tour in seven years and her new single, Scared of Loving Wild Again.
Academy Award-nominated actor Wagner Moura chats to Nick about his new film and picks some music to play.
Lauren welcomes you to a brand new week with uplifting tunes.
Ahead of their upcoming UK tour, Paul from Madra Salach chats to Craig about their new EP 'It's a Hell of An Age', before draping himself in the Cloak of Folk.
Huw Stephens sits in and is joined by singer songwriter Murkage Dave ahead of his new album release, Brut Thoughts, in March.
Nathan and Deb reveal this week's Breaking Artist KAVARI, a DJ from Glasgow, following the release of her latest single IRON VEINS. Also, The Rundown is all about dark dance music.
Marc Riley welcomes Congratulations in for a session and plays the T Shirt Game - Love It!
1/4. 6 Music Festival 2026 headliners The Horrors share their favourite UK psychedelic music.
